subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Any one can help me?Question
author: Frank Sumption
full_text:
The triangle wave is really low frequency, maybe from less than a hertz to
just a few cycles per seconds. Ideally you want to sweep so you are not
getting many whole words and phrases, that way it's not so confusing to
listen to. the ghsot voices should kinda pop out of the raw audio.

F-S

On Sat, Aug 21, 2010 at 8:02 PM, Luis <luispucp098@...> wrote:

>
>
>
> Hi Frank , thanks again for your answers , i have another question , i need
> to know what is the range of frecuencies of triangle wave , i know its
> variable, but , what is the common range , like lower frecuencie ,and max
> frecuencie? .... for example when the pot is totally right turned , the
> frecuencie min is .....
> and when the pot is totally left turned , the frecuencie is ...
>
> --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com <EVP-ITC%40yahoogroups.com>, Frank Sumption
> <purplealiengirl@...> wrote:
> >
> > I make the triangle sweep adjustable so I can cover the entire AM or FM
> > band. Some tuners have different sweep requirements for each band, so
> > sometimes have to add a pot to adjust the max level for one of the bands.
> > AM=530 to 1710 Khz and FM 88.5 to 108mhz, but you don't have to cover the
> > entire band, all that is required is enough to provide the raw audio bits
> > the entities use to make their voices.
> >
> > A Danish researcher back in the 80s was just "wobbling" between a couple
> > stations to make contact. His name was Stein and there's more info on the
> > German VTF site. Stein also has his sweep circuit there.
> >
> > The best sounding systems seem to be the way Steve Hultay makes his, by
> > adding sweep to a complete radio. see keyportparanormal.com. I take the
> > tuners out of the radio, and supply my own amplifier and sweep. At
> present
> > I'm making a box using a Timex clock radio tuner, the triangle sweep, and
> > computer sound amplifier and speaker system for the bass response. I just
> > started this project yesterday. I use Timex model T309T AM/FM/nature
> sounds
> > clock radios when I can find them in thrift stores cheap. I found a Timex
> > model T313T this morning, and hoping it has the seperate tuner board
> inside,
> > as the 300 series has so far.
> >
> > I used to use car stereo tuner modules, but those tend to be too noisy.
> Box
> > 13, that Hultay just got back is based on a car tuner. He did a YouTube
> > video of it.
> >
> > I'm still pretty much an amateur at this, there are so many variables.
> >
> > Frank-S
> >
> > On Fri, Aug 20, 2010 at 6:35 PM, Luis <luispucp098@...> wrote:
> >
> > >
> > >
> > > I am very glad for your atention Frank , i will make a box and i need
> it be
> > > very good , for best results . So , your answer says to me the
> diferents
> > > results take origin by materials , not much the dimensions , isnt it? .
> > > Another important question , what is the range of frecuencies of the
> > > triangle wave ? I know about the model of radio determine that , but
> what is
> > > the common range ? ... hz? , khz? ...
> > >
> > > --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com <EVP-ITC%40yahoogroups.com> <EVP-ITC%
> 40yahoogroups.com>, Frank Sumption
> > > <purplealiengirl@> wrote:
> > > >
> > > > Aluminum seems to work the best. I got a voice that sounded like
> Raudive
> > > > saying copper. I have used plastic and wood. Different materials seem
> to
> > > > allow different levels, but it's hard to tell for sure who/what is
> > > talking.
> > > >
> > > > Folding the tube seems to make it act like a larger tube. With just a
> > > long
> > > > straight tube the sound tends to be tinny. I made a chamber 12 inches
> > > square
> > > > and 4 feet long from MDF board lined with aluminum foil years ago,
> the
> > > > voices were almost demonic sounding, so I took it apart.
> > > >
> > > > The only difference with the hacked radio is the sweep. With the hack
> > > radio
> > > > the sweep steps so the radio is tuned in 10khz increments. With the
> box
> > > it's
> > > > a continuous sweep, linear uses a triangle wave.
> > > >
> > > > F-S
> > > >
> > > > On Fri, Aug 20, 2010 at 4:01 PM, Luis <luispucp098@> wrote:
> > > >

> like
> > > a box
> > > > > built ? (considering echo in box)

> > >

> > > > > >
> > > > > > It's just a chamber, an enclosure, anything can be used depending
> on
> > > how
> > > > > > much room you have. The effect is like a mechanical sound filter.
> The
> > > > > larger
> > > > > > the siaze the lower tyhe effected frequencies. I use tubing so it
> can
> > > be
> > > > > > made smaller to fit inside a cabinet. I don't even measure
> anything
> > > when
> > > > > I
> > > > > > make an echo chamber, it's just made to fit whatever cabinet I'm
> > > using.
> > > > > >
> > > > > > The boxes work without the chamber, but the chamber seems to add
> > > > > something,
> > > > > > maybe a space where the sound can be more easily manipulated.
> > > > > >
> > > > > > F-S
> > > > > >
